go_data.justification: CD28 delivers a positive costimulatory signal, enhancing the production of certain lymphokines such as IL-2.
CD28 binds to B7.1 and B7.2 on antigen-presenting cells, delivering a costimulatory signal to T cells.
CD28 is involved in the regulation of T cell activation and the production of lymphokines.
CD28 binds to B7.1 and B7.2, delivering a costimulatory signal to T cells.
CD28 is a cell surface receptor that interacts with B7 molecules on antigen-presenting cells.
